intro: Brachystelma bruceae, commonly known as the Bruce's ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It produces bright yellow or orange flowers during the winter months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and arid landscapes.
